part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Section 395(1)(a)(i), (iii) and (iv) of Ordinance

section.name: s2
section.heading: Annual fees, application fees, etc.
section.content: A fee described in column 2 of Schedule 1, which is prescribed opposite the description in column 3 of that Schedule, shall be payable to the Commission.

subsection.content: The annual fee prescribed in item 1 of Schedule 1 shall be payable on or before each anniversary of the date on which authorization of the provision of automated trading services concerned under section 95(2) of the Ordinance is granted.

The annual fee prescribed in item 1A of Schedule 1 is payable on or before each anniversary of the date on which the central counterparty concerned is designated under section 101J(1)(a) of the Ordinance. (L.N. 32 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: The annual fee prescribed in item 4 of Schedule 1 shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where it is first payable in respect of authorization of a collective investment scheme under section 104 of the Ordinance, on or before the date on which the authorization takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it is subsequently so payable, on or before each successive anniversary of the date on which the authorization takes effect.

subsection.content: Any fee, other than an annual fee referred to in subsection (1), (1A) or (2), prescribed in Schedule 1 shall be payable at the time when the application or request to which the fee relates is made. (L.N. 32 of 2016)

part.name: P3
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Section 395(1)(a)(ii) of Ordinance

section.name: s4
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Codes (《守則》) means the codes entitled “The Codes on Takeovers and Mergers and Share Buy-backs” and published by the Commission under section 399(2)(a) and (b) of the Ordinance; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
Executive (執行人員) means the Executive Director of the Corporate Finance Division of the Commission or any delegate of the Executive Director;
Introduction to the Codes (《守則》引言) means the part of the Codes entitled “Introduction”;

offer (要約) has the meaning assigned to it by the Codes and, in any case where section 5(2)(a)(ii) is applicable, includes any of the alternative offers or offers of different values (as the case may be) referred to in that section;
offer document (要約文件) means a document required to be submitted to the Executive under the Codes in connection with an offer;
offeree company (要約標的公司) means a corporation for which an offer is made in accordance with the Codes;
off-market share buy-back (場外股份回購) has the meaning given by the Codes; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

off-market share buy-back circular (場外股份回購通告) means a document required to be submitted to the Executive under the Share Buy-backs Code in connection with an off-market share buy-back; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an offer contained in an offer document, means the securities which are the subject of the offer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an off-market share buy-back contained in an off-market share buy-back circular, means the securities which are the subject of the off-market share buy-back; or (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c

section.def: ruling (裁定) includes any ruling, waiver, consent, decision, confirmation or other determination in writing, made under the Codes by the Executive, the Takeovers Panel or the Takeovers Appeal Committee;

Share Buy-backs Code (《股份回購守則》) means the parts of the Codes respectively entitled “Introduction”, “Definitions”, “General Principles”, “Code on Share Buy-backs” and “Schedules”; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
Takeovers Appeal Committee (收購上訴委員會) means the committee established under section 8 of the Ordinance and known as the Takeovers Appeal Committee;
Takeovers Code (《收購守則》) means the parts of the Codes respectively entitled “Introduction”, “Definitions”, “General Principles”, “Code on Takeovers and Mergers” and “Schedules”;
Takeovers Panel (收購委員會) means the committee established under section 8 of the Ordinance and known as the Takeovers and Mergers Panel;
whitewash document (清洗交易文件) means a document required to be submitted to the Executive under the Whitewash Guidance Note in Schedule VI to the Codes;

whitewashed offer (清洗交易要約), in relation to a whitewash document, means an offer which would be required to be made under Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code in the absence of a waiver under Note 1 on dispensations from Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Fees relating to offer documents, off-market share buy-back circulars and whitewash documents

subsection.content: Where a first draft of an offer document, off-market share buy-back circular or whitewash document is submitted to the Executive for comment, a fee which is prescribed, opposite the applicable value set out in column 1 of Schedule 2, in column 2 of that Schedule shall be payable to the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the applicable value shall be equivalent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an offer document—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), to the value of the offer contained in the offer document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the offer document contains alternative offers to the same offeree company, or contains 2 or more offers of different values to different offeree companies, to the value of the offer contained in the offer document which has the lower or lowest value;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in the case of a whitewash document, to the value of the whitewashed offer.

subsection.leadIn: Where any offer contained in a draft offer document previously submitted to the Executive for comment is replaced by a revised offer, and a revised offer document is submitted to the Executive in connection with the revised offer, there shall be payable to the Commission a fee the amount of which shall be the difference between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fee previously paid under subsection (1) on the submission of the draft offer document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee which would have been payable under subsection (1) had the revised offer been contained in such draft offer document.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the value of any offer contained in an offer document or the value of an off-market share buy-back contained in an off-market share buy-back circular shall be— (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: where the relevant shares are under the offer or the off-market share buy-back (as the case may be) to be acquired in exchange for securities, the total value of such securities on the date of announcement of a firm intention to make the offer or the off-market share buy-back (as the case may be) in accordance with the Codes; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the relevant shares are under the offer or the off-market share buy-back (as the case may be) to be acquired partly for cash and partly in exchange for securities, the aggregate of the total amount of such cash and the total value of such securities on the date of announcement of a firm intention to make the offer or the off-market share buy-back (as the case may be) in accordance with the Codes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the value of a whitewashed offer in the case of a whitewash document shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the relevant shares would under such whitewashed offer be acquired for cash, the total amount of such cash;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the relevant shares would under such whitewashed offer be acquired in exchange for securities, the total value of such securities on the date of announcement of a firm intention to enter into the transaction which would require such whitewashed offer to be made in the absence of a waiver under Note 1 on dispensations from Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the relevant shares would under such whitewashed offer be acquired partly for cash and partly in exchange for securities, the aggregate of the total amount of such cash and the total value of such securities on the date of announcement of a firm intention to enter into the transaction which would require such whitewashed offer to be made in the absence of a waiver under Note 1 on dispensations from Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code,

subsection.continued: and where the application of this subsection may, in the case of any offer contained in an offer document or any whitewashed offer in the case of a whitewash document, result in 2 or more variable values, only the lower or lowest value shall be taken into account.

subsection.content: The payment of a fee payable under this section shall be accompanied by a statement showing the value of the offer, off-market share buy-back or whitewashed offer concerned and the manner in which the fee is determined having regard to subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: Where a first draft of an offer document, a first draft of an off-market share buy-back circular and a first draft of a whitewash document, or any combination of them, are combined in a draft when submitted to the Executive for comment— (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fee payable under subsection (1) shall be the aggregate of the respective fees payable under that subsection in respect of each such first draft as if each such first draft had not been so combined in the draft, and the provisions of this section shall apply accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to paragraph (a), subsection (3) shall apply as if—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the reference to a revised offer document included a reference to that draft as revised to include the revised offer.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Fees for applications to Takeovers Panel or Takeovers Appeal Committee
section.leadIn: Where, pursuant to the Codes, a person other than the Executive applies to the Takeovers Panel for a review of any ruling of the Executive, or applies to the Takeovers Appeal Committee for a review of the appropriateness of any sanction imposed by the Takeovers Panel pursuant to the Codes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee of $50,000 shall be payable by the person to the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional fee of $20,000 shall be payable by the person to the Commission within 30 days after the delivery by the Takeovers Panel or the Takeovers Appeal Committee (as the case may be) of its ruling, in respect of each day or part of a day in excess of the first 2 days on which the Takeovers Panel or the Takeovers Appeal Committee (as the case may be) meets for the purposes of the review.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fees for hearings concerning compliance with Codes or any rulings under them

subsection.leadIn: Where a hearing takes place before the Takeovers Panel in any disciplinary proceedings instituted under section 12 of the Introduction to the Codes, a fee, the amount of which shall be determined in accordance with subsection (3), shall, within 30 days after the delivery by the Takeovers Panel of its ruling, be payable to the Commission by any person who in the opinion of the Takeovers Panel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has caused unnecessary expense to be incurred in connection with the investigation by the Commission of any allegation against the person or with the conduct of the hearing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has committed a breach of the Takeovers Code, the Share Buy-backs Code or a ruling of the Executive or the Takeovers Panel.

subsection.content: Where a hearing takes place before the Takeovers Panel for the purpose of deliberating the appropriate sanction to be imposed upon a person who has agreed that he is in breach of the Takeovers Code, the Share Buy-backs Code or a ruling of the Executive or the Takeovers Panel, a fee, the amount of which shall be determined in accordance with subsection (3), shall be payable to the Commission by the person within 30 days after the delivery by the Takeovers Panel of its ruling.

The fee payable under subsection (1) or (2) shall be $50,000 and, in addition, $20,000 in respect of each day or part of a day in excess of the first 2 days on which the Takeovers Panel meets for the purposes of the hearing in question.

Subject to subsection (2), where any person applies to the Executive for any ruling under the Takeovers Code or the Share Buy-backs Code and no fee is otherwise provided for by these Rules for the application, a fee of $24,000 shall be payable by the person to the Commission. (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

Where a fee has been paid under section 5 on the submission of a first draft of a whitewash document, or of a draft in which a first draft of a whitewash document is combined with any first draft of any other document, no fee shall be payable under subsection (1) for an application to the Executive for a waiver in relation to the whitewash document under Note 1 on dispensations from Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code.

subsection.leadIn: The fee prescribed in section 5 shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a fee payable under section 5(1), at the time when—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the first draft concerned; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where section 5(6)(a) applies, the draft concerned,

paragraph.continued: is submitted to the Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a fee payable under section 5(3), at the time when—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the revised offer document concerned; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where section 5(6)(b)(ii) applies, the draft concerned (being the draft as revised to include the revised offer as described in that section 5(6)(b)(ii)),

subsection.content: The fee prescribed in section 6(a) shall be payable at the time when the application concerned is made to the Takeovers Panel or the Takeovers Appeal Committee (as the case may be).
The fee prescribed in section 8(1) shall be payable at the time when the application concerned is made to the Executive.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Section 395(1)(b) of Ordinance

section.name: s10
section.heading: Fees which under Ordinance are prescribed by rules
section.content: A fee described in column 2 of Schedule 3 is prescribed, opposite the description, in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Commission may, in relation to any person or class of persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive, in whole or in part, the payment of any fee provided for under these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refund, in whole or in part, any fee paid as provided for under these Rules,

subsection.continued: if it is of the opinion that otherwise the payment of the fee would be unduly burdensome or inappropriate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive the payment of the fee prescribed in item 6 of Schedule 1 to the extent that the fee exceeds $1,200;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: waive the payment of the fee prescribed in item 7 of Schedule 1 to the extent that the fee exceeds $600.

subsection.leadIn: Where a corporation, an authorized financial institution or an individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, or applies to be, licensed, registered or approved for Type 1 or Type 2 regulated activity under section 116, 119, 120(1), 126 or 127(1) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is, or applies to be, licensed, registered or approved for Type 7 regulated activity under section 116, 119, 120(1), 126 or 127(1) of the Ordinance,

subsection.continued: if the carrying on, or proposed carrying on, of Type 7 regulated activity by the corporation, authorized financial institution or individual (as the case may be) is incidental to the carrying on, or proposed carrying on, of Type 1 or Type 2 (as the case may be) regulated activity by the corporation, authorized financial institution or individual (as the case may be)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 3, under paragraph (A), of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 5 of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 6, under paragraph (A), of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 12 of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 13(a)(i), under paragraph (A), of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 13(b)(i), under paragraph (A), of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the fee prescribed in item 13(c)(i) of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity,

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the payment of the annual fee prescribed in item 18 of Schedule 3 for Type 7 regulated activity shall be waived.

subsection.content: Where the occurrence of an event occasions the need to make an application under section 122(1) or (2), 126(1), 127(1) or 134(1) of the Ordinance as well as an application for which a fee is prescribed in item 9(a) or (b) (as the case may be) of Schedule 1, the payment of the fee prescribed in item 9(a) or (b) (as the case may be) of that Schedule for the latter application shall be waived.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where any fee prescribed in an item in Schedule 3 is described as being so prescribed under paragraph (A), the reference to the fee so described shall be construed as a reference only to the part of the fee that is so prescribed under such paragraph (A) that appears in that item in column 3 of that Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), where any fee prescribed in an item in Schedule 3 (whether or not it is also described as being so prescribed under paragraph (A)) is described as being so prescribed for Type 7 regulated activity, the reference to the fee so described shall be construed as a reference only to the part of the fee that is so prescribed with reference to that regulated activity (however described).
